intro: Galium latoramosum, commonly known as spreading bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems that root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium latoramosum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
